etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in New-England Galaxy. From sun + glow

definitions: The glow or light of the sun; sunlight, sunshine.
A glow or glare of sunlight or sunshine.
A hazy diffused glow occasionally seen around the sun due to fine solid particles in the upper atmosphere, typically after a volcanic eruption.

notes.text: Originally with reference to the eruption of Krakatoa in Indonesia in 1883.

definitions: Designating an orange-yellow colour resembling that of the glow or light of the sun; having this colour.
